args: Please note that this story contains spoilers\nfor the Northern Negotiators event.
You did well in the negotiations with\nChanzelia, Joachim. I leave that\nmanacaster in your hands—use it well.
You sure? This is the only one we ended\nup with, so protocol says it's yours.
I care about resources being in the best\nhands, not protocol. Speaking of which,\nisn't it time you considered the promotion?
Care to try a more intelligent response?\nHQ has been asking for a while now.
Yeees, but I'm pretty sure I told you\nI had to humbly pass on their offer.
You did indeed say that—\nbut I never said I approved.
I understand your reasons for turning down\nevery promotion you're offered, and I'm in\nno position to butt in given my role...
But HQ isn't interested in your sentimental\nreasonings. You're a soldier.
I need you to make yourself useful,\nJoachim. Don't let me down.
I want your answer by the time you return\nto base, soldier. Now, I have matters to\nattend to, so I'm going on ahead.
Oh, don't let her down? Is that all? Ugh.
(Great, I'm already back at base\nand I'm STILL not done fretting.)
Er, s-sorry, Joachim,  but you seem kind\nof...down. Are you okay?
Oh, uh, yeah. Fine. Nothing you need to\nworry yourself about, Noelle.
But I DO worry. Also, Kirsty told me to look\nin on you. Er, actually she ordered me.
Thanks a lot, Kirsty... Ugh, okay. So you\nknow how I got offered a promotion before\nthis mission?
Th-that was the letter from HQ that I\ndelivered to you, right?!
Right. Kirsty's telling me to accept it,\nbut I keep trying to turn her down. That's\nwhat's got me spinning at the moment.
If I take it, I'm suddenly a big shot—maybe\neven the kind of big shot who has a whole\nsquadron serving under him.
And I'm not the kind of guy who should\nhave ANYONE'S life in his hands.
Little intense there, Noelle.\nMaybe ease up on the whole\npeering-into-my-soul thing.
Fine! I'll talk! Just don't do that any more.\nOh, and you can't tell this to anyone.
So seven years ago, I commanded a\nplatoon. I was young, and—frankly—\nsort of an idiot.
...And that's how I got my sister killed.
We were deployed right into the war with Barthe.\nI gave it all I had—which wasn't much—but soon\nthe enemy was a step ahead at every turn.
But my sister was a part of the volunteer medical\ncorps stationed at our base, so I couldn't back off.\nI fought like hell to keep her safe, but one day...
*pant* *wheeze* *gasp* Oh man,\nthis is NOTHING like training...
But she's counting on me back at base.\nWe have to hold the line here!
...Er, hang on. Does it seem like there are\nfewer enemies than normal today?
Message from the base, sir! They need\nimmediate reinforcements! Barthe soldiers\nhave breached our defenses!
What?! But we've been holding them here!
Th-they outflanked us, sir. Kept us pinned\ndown here while they sent a detachment\naround to cut off our supply line.

I sprinted the whole way there, but it was too late.
The base was in flames, the defenses in shambles.
When we finally managed to push them back,
I started running through the base like a crazy man
desperately searching for my sister.
It's safe now! You can come out!
I'm glad...you're safe... Heh. But looks\nlike you got kicked around real good.
Stop talking and just be still, Sis.\nWe need to get you patched up.
Don't... It won't matter. But you need to\ntake care of all those bumps and bruises...
Dammit, I told you to stop moving!
This isn't the time to... Sis?
I was green, and the enemy outplayed me.\nI lost a large part of my platoon...\nand my own sister, too.
If anyone else had been in command,\nshe'd still be alive.
Y-you can't know that for sure.
That's why I got no interest in\nclimbing the ladder again.
An idiot who couldn't keep his only sister\nalive has no business making life-or-death\ndecisions for anyone.
Hey, don't make that face, Noelle.\nI know how much Kirsty expects of me,\nand I'm grateful for it. Really.
But I just... I can't. Every time I try,\nmy sister just pops into my head.
＂Don't let this happen to anyone else,＂\nI hear her say.
B-but, Joachim, I... I think you—
Yep. What's got you all worked up?
It's an emergency! Commander Kirsty\njust got back, and she's been hauled off\nby Commander Balboa!
Oh, hell. Balboa's the poster boy for\nthe faction backing the current king!
They might've found out about the letter\nshe got from the resistance.
But... I mean, she hasn't written a reply!\nThey have no grounds to hold her!
I'm sure they're looking to nip the issue in\nthe bud—but she's a commander, so they\nalso can't just lock her up on a whim.
W-we're under attack! The whole place\nis surrounded by an unknown force!
They brought serious numbers—I think\nthey're looking to take the base!
Oh, this day just keeps getting better!
